item.title: Running horizon under SSL
item.description:
Running OpenStackâ€™s horizon under SSL.

pip install django-extensions pyOpenSSL

python manage.py runserver_plus --cert cert

item.title: Python itertools
item.description:
This is the first post to make cheat sheets of the python standard library

Itertools

import itertools

Chain

To combine iterables

from itertools import chain

print list(chain([1, 2, 3], ['a', 'b', 'c']))
# [1, 2, 3, 'a', 'b', 'c']

izip

To combine elements into tuples

from itertools import izip

print list(izip([1, 2, 3], ['a', 'b', 'c']))
# [(1, 'a'), (2, 'b'), (3, 'c')]

islice

To make slices from datasets

from itertools import islice

for i in islice(range(10), 5):
    print i     
# 0
# 1
# 2
# 3
# 4

tee

To create multiple instances of the same iterable

from itertools import tee

i1, i2, i3 = tee(xrange(10), 3)

imap

To map a function with a list of values

from itertools import imap

print list(imap(lambda x: x * x, xrange(10)))
# [0, 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49, 64, 81]

count

To count objects when no ending might be possible, we define start and step.

from itertools import count

for number, letter in izip(count(0, 10), ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e']):
    print '{0}: {1}'.format(number, letter)     
# 0: a
# 10: b
# 20: c
# 30: d
# 40: e

cycle

To iterate over a sequence over and over until the function is stopped

from itertools import cycle

for number, letter in izip(cycle(range(2)), ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e']):
    print '{0}: {1}'.format(number, letter)  
# 0: a
# 1: b
# 0: c
# 1: d
# 0: e

repeat

To create an iterable with items that are repeated either indefinitely or with a limit

from itertools import cycle

for number, letter in izip(cycle(range(2)), ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e']):
    print '{0}: {1}'.format(number, letter)  
# 0: a
# 1: b
# 0: c
# 1: d
# 0: e

filter

To create a new iterable using the filter provided

from itertools import ifilter

print list(ifilter(lambda x: x < 10, [1, 4, 6, 7, 11, 34, 66, 100, 1]))
# [1, 4, 6, 7, 1]

groupby

To create a new iterable using the filter provided

from operator import itemgetter
from itertools import groupby

attempts = [
    ('dan', 87),
    ('erik', 95),
    ('jason', 79),
    ('erik', 97),
    ('dan', 100)
]

# Sort the list by name for groupby
attempts.sort(key=itemgetter(0))

# Create a dictionary such that name: scores_list
print {key: sorted(map(itemgetter(1), value)) for key, value in groupby(attempts, key=itemgetter(0))}
# {'dan': [87, 100], 'jason': [79], 'erik': [95, 97]}

item.title: Javascript patterns
item.description:
Module Design Pattern

helps encapsulate code and provide public and private methods

var HTMLChanger = (function () {
    var contents = 'contents'

    var changeHTML = function() {
      var element = document.getElementById('attribute-to-change');
      element.innerHTML = contents;
    }

    return {
      callChangeHTML = function() {
        changeHTML()
        console.log('lol')
      }
    };
})();

HTMLChanger.callChangeHTML()

Revealing Design Pattern

var Exposer = (function() {
  var privateVariable = 10

  var privateMethod = function() {
    console.log('privateMethod')
  }

  var methodToExpose = function () {
    console.log('expose this method')
  }

  return {
    publicMethod = methodToExpose
  };
})();

Exposer.publicMethod()

item.title: Powershell notes
item.description:
Tail command equivalent

Get-Content file.log -Wait

touch equivalent

New-Item file.log -type file

item.title: Git configurations
item.description:
Change remote url to use git instead of https

git remote set-url origin git@github.com:user/repo.git

Update .gitignore to add more entries

git rm -r --cached .

item.title: Jquery show and hide items
item.description:
Hide and show items according to dropdown selection

<select id="action">
  <option value="backup">Backup</option>
  <option value="restore">Restore</option>
</select>

<input type="text" id="backup_input" name="backup_input" value="backup"/>
<input type="text" id="restore_input" name="restore_input" value="restore"/>

<script src="http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.11.3.min.js"></script>

<script type="text/javascript">

$(document).ready(function(){
	$("#action").change(function() {
		if ($("#action").val() == 'backup') {
			$("#restore_input").hide();
		}
		else {
			$("#restore_input").show();
		}
	});

	$("#action").change();
});
</script>

item.title: Sync date and time in ubuntu
item.description:
This is very common when you pause a vm

sudo ntpdate ntp.ubuntu.com

Or if you need to change the date

sudo date --set "11 Jun 2015 14:49:00"

item.title: Geolocation in the browser with javascript
item.description:
Get your current location

using NProgress.js

function findMe() {
    "use strict";
    NProgress.start()
    if (!navigator.geolocation) {
        console.log("geolocation not available");
        return;
    }

    function success(position) {
        var latitude = position.coords.latitude;
        var longitude = position.coords.longitude;
        google.maps.event.addDomListener(window,
        'load',
        initialize(latitude, longitude));
    }
    function error() {
        console.error("Unable to retrieve your location");
    }
    var options = {timeout: 60000};
    navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(success, error, options);
}

item.title: Google maps
item.description:
Insert a map in your website

using NProgress.js

function initialize(latitude, longitude) {

    "use strict";

    var map_canvas = document.getElementById('map_canvas');

    var map_options = {
        center: new google.maps.LatLng(latitude, longitude),
        zoom: 15,
        mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId.ROADMAP,
        disableDefaultUI: true
    };
    var latlng = new google.maps.LatLng(latitude, longitude);
    var map = new google.maps.Map(map_canvas, map_options)

    map.set('styles', []);

    var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
      position: latlng,
      map: map,
    });
    
    NProgress.done()
}
